## Esna 218 {-}

- Location: Column 3
- Date: Probably Domitian 
- [Hieroglyphic Text](https://www.ifao.egnet.net/uploads/publications/enligne/Temples-Esna003.pdf#page=105){target="_blank"}  
- Bibliography: See [Tempeltexte 2.0](http://www.tempeltexte.uni-tuebingen.de/portal/#/text-detail/942)
- Parallels: Multiple phrases from this offering scene, including the rare spelling of 'Atum', occur in the Hapi procession from the facade of the pronaos: *Esna* II, 54.

#### Formula {-}

<div class="col2">  

^1^ *[...] sḫ.t m ḥr=t*  
*ỉḫt=s r ḫft-ḥr=t*  
*(?) nty [...]*  
  
^1^ [...] the field before you,  
its products in front of you  
(?) which [...]  

</div>  

#### The King {-}

<div class="col2"> 

^2^ *[nṯr nfr]  * 
*[...] n ḫnty-wȝr=f*  
*mzỉ rwḏ m sḫ.t *   
*ȝpd.w [...]*  

^2^ [The good god]
[...replica] of Khenty-waref,
who brings what grows in the field,
birds [...]

</div>  

#### Menhyt {-}

<div class="col2"> 

^3^ *ḏd-mdw n Mnḥyt-Nb.t-ww *  
*[...]*  
*[...]* ^4^ *sḫ.t*  
*sḫp(r.t) ỉḫt nb.w *  
*m kȝ.w [...]*  
*[npry]* ^5^ *n tpy.w-tȝ*  
*nb(.t) šȝ[.w...]*  
^6^ *nb(.t) rȝ.w ʿšȝ ḥb.w*  
   
^7^ *dỉ=ỉ n=k sḫ.t [...]*  
*ỉmy.w[=s] nb.w*  
  
^3^ Words spoken by Menhyt-Nebtu  
[...]  
^4^ [...] the field,  
who creates all things,  
consisting of food [...]  
[grain] ^5^ for those upon earth;  
Lady of the marshes [...]  
^6^ Lady of geese, numerous of fowl.  
 
</div>  

#### Heka {-}

<div class="col2"> 

^8^ **ḏd-mdw n Ḥkȝ *  
*wr-ḥkȝw zȝ Sḫm.t*  
*ḫy* ^9^ *[...]*  
*[...] Ỉtm m ḥwnw rnp *  
^10^ *[...] rʿ-nb*  
   
^11^ *dỉ=ỉ thm=k rȝ.w nb m Qbḥw*  
  
^8^ Words spoken by Heka,  
greatest of magic, son of Sakhmet,  
child ^9^ [...]  
[...] Atum[^fn-218-9] as a rejuvenated youth,  
^10^ [...] daily.  
  
^11^ I compel all geese from Qebehu to you.[^fn-218-10]  

</div>

[^fn-218-9]: ![](./images/218_9_1.png){width=10%} - For this spelling of Atum, see also *Esna* II, 54, 12; 67, 12; 163, 13.
[^fn-218-10]: Compare especially *Esna* II, 54, 4.

#### Behind the Divinities {-}

<div class="col2"> 

^12^ *nsw.t-bỉty*  
*sḫ.t nb sḫ.t*  
*ȝḫ.t nb ȝḫ.t*  
*Rnn.t nfr.t *  
*[nb.t] nfrw*  
*šms(.t) ỉb=s m ww*  
*zb(.t)-sš m [...]*  
*[...] sḫ.t nfr.t*  
*Mnḥy.t-Nb.t-ww nb sḫ.t*
  
^12^ King of Upper and Lower Egypt,  
Sekhet, lord of the *sḫ.t*-field,  
Akhet, lord of the *ȝḫ.t*-field,  
Good Renenutet,  
[Lady] of goodness;  
she who folows her heart in the prairie,  
who 'roams the marshes' in [...]  
[...] the good field:  
Menhyt-Nebtu, Lady of the Field.

</div>
